DOC.detailed_description: Acute kidney injury represent important clinical problem hospitalize patient , persistently high rate mortality morbidity . With ever-increasing number patient receive intravascular injection iodinate contrast medium worldwide , contrast induce nephropathy ( CIN ) become third leading cause hospital-acquired AKI . Approximately half case patient undergoing cardiac catheterization procedure . The prevention early intervention CIN hamper mainly lack consensus definition paucity early predictive biomarkers accurately identify high-risk patient . CIN frequently define increase serum creatinine ( sCr ) 25-50 % baseline , generally occur within first 24 h contrast exposure , absence cause . However , sCr unreliable indicator acute change kidney function , alteration sCr level particularly sensitive specific small change glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) e , gender , race intravascular volume . DOC.criteria: Patients age 18 year old undergoing plan PCI prospectively recruit Pregnancy Lactation Sepsis The intravascular administration contrast medium within past 7 day , nephroprotective drug treatment ( e.g. , Nacetylcysteine , theophylline , sodium bicarbonate , prostaglandin E1 ) Nephrotoxic drug intake ( e.g. , nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug , metformin , aminoglycosides , cisplatin ) within past 7 day A history serious allergic contrast medium Renal transplantation Endstage renal disease necessitate dialysis Severe concomitant disease system .
